title: Define Project Requirements and Scope (REVISED)
description: Gather and document user stories, functional requirements, and project constraints for the NutritionBalancer application. This includes edge cases, error handling, system performance considerations, as well as non-functional requirements such as security, scalability, and accessibility. Additionally, specify the data sources to be integrated for meal planning purposes.

title: Design the NutritionBalancer Architecture
description: Create a high-level architecture design for the application, considering aspects such as frontend, backend, and database.

title: Create Frontend Components for User Interface
description: Design and implement the frontend components for user interaction, including login/signup pages, goal settings, meal plan display, etc.

title: Implement Backend Services for AI Model Integration
description: Develop backend services to integrate the AI model for generating personalized meal plans based on individual health goals and preferences.

title: Establish Database Schema and Connect to Backend Services
description: Design and implement the database schema for storing user information, health goals, meal plans, etc., and ensure proper connection with the backend services.

title: Implement Test Cases and Write Unit Tests for Backend Services
description: Create test cases and write unit tests to ensure the correct functioning of backend services, particularly those related to AI model integration.
dependencies: Implement Backend Services for AI Model Integration

title: Conduct Code Reviews and Provide Feedback
description: Review the code written by team members, provide constructive feedback, and ensure adherence to best practices.
dependencies: Create Frontend Components for User Interface
Implement Backend Services for AI Model Integration

title: Prepare Documentation and Technical Writings
description: Write clear, concise, and accurate documentation on the application architecture, integration of AI models, usage instructions, etc.
